content: The Statue of Liberty was gifted to the United States by which European country?

The Statue of Liberty was gifted to the United States by France. This iconic statue was a symbol of friendship and liberty, and it was dedicated on October 28, 1886. The statue was designed by French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi, and its metal framework was engineered by Gustave Eiffel, who also designed the Eiffel Tower. The statue stands on Liberty Island in New York Harbor and has become an enduring symbol of freedom and democracy.
